page.title: 05DUDMASTON SAWMILL SHROPSHIRE
page.content:
{ Dudmaston Sawmill}is privately owned, with the land being rented from the {National Trust.}One would expect the timber to come from the local coniferous forests on the estate, but this is not so; much of the wood comes from within a{50 mile radius,}mainly from{Mid-Wales.
The mill has 10 machines, 7 inside and 3 outside, with a workforce of 12. They produce a variety of posts and gates, as well as fencing stakes, tree stakes, pallisade, and trellis. The 2 main{markets}are the{West Midlands}and {London.
